text: Ostlander Pork Belly, rich of fat is popular amongst Ostlandic infantry and mercenary Ogres.
''Sit a while, and listen. Listen to my advice. I'll make you rich before you know it''.
Corn from Averland is rich of nutriants that prolong battle effectiveness.
Foul stench still lingers on these pelts, but their thickness surely protects it's wielder in battle.
Furs that protect against even the harshest cold and sharpest arrow.
''If you help me now, I'll help you later. It's how politics work''.
''You think you are safe from the Zegepraal just because we are on land? Think again''.
Ment to be used for hooking one ship to the other, it could just as well be used to hook a few legs together.
''Here, a gift for you. A Marienburg specialty. Just don't open it when I'm around, it is considered rude to do so''.
Big Piet has bested many of champion before in combat, this rabble will only add to that list.
Whether or not intended, the paymasters invigorate the Marienburger troops to fight on. Perhaps it's the idea the of picking up crumbs dropped by the baggage train.
Bound to their agreement, one party is compelled to lower arms for the mere bribe of a few gold coins
To get Haeyndrik's attention one would first need the eye of his Arch-Priest.
Goudenkruin would often mutter prayers to the Merchant God and every transaction seems to go your way. This luck translates to the battlefield, where blows simply brush off the Arch-Priest

Many advisors close to Jaan van de Kuypers warned him for the odd qualities his Lucky Coin possesses. To envy he attributed their pleas. His coin, obtained during a trade voyage to Lustria, has gotten him out of the most dire situations, and he'd rather give up a loved one before parting with his trinket.
Which sane soul would be able to resist the prospect of pure gold? Even amongst the midst of battle, the tempation is too great. Well, try fighting with a few gold bars hidden in your tunic.
Nicknamed the Murderers out of Marienburg, the Van Klumpf's Buccanneers are as ruthless as they are expensive. It is hard to distinguish this Empire Regiment from Pirate Raiders.
On board is a team of Van Reeveldt's carpenters, who can repair damages to the Landship. During the repairs the vessel is in a vulnerable state.

The Hat formerly worn by the Elector Count of Westerland, the heirless Paulus van der Maacht, now a token of influence and power. Is said to be blessed by the God Haeyndrik himself and is rumoured to hold protective powers.
This eldritch explosion propels lacerating shards of ice outwards, devastating anyone caught in its deadly squall.
Those who have been marked by Solkan to be judged, shall not escape his wrath.
All fear the Spirit of Vengeance, moving unseen and unheard - on it's way to deliver imminent justice.
None can outrun Solkan's judgement, as in time all shall fall under his merciless gaze. Fleeing is only postponing the inevatible.
Solkan's magical ring allows him to adapt many forms, furthermore, giving him a natural disguise.
Solkan's magical ring allows him to adapt many forms, furthermore, giving him a natural disguise.
When the smell of blood reaches the banner, it screams and wails in an unholy and thoroughly disconcerting fashion, exhorting those that fight beneath it to cruelty and bloodlust.
River Boats are a famous export product of both Marienburg and Bechafen, these small crafts can manouver narrow rivers, and are great for catching freeloaders.
With a Lord who learned the art of warfare on the Reiksacademy, armies move fight and withdraw more effectively.
The Black Caps keep the lights on Marienburg many dark streets, revealing dealing supposed to remain secret.
Once the Gaze of Tsien-Tsin is locked on a careless victim, it is stunned in place as their mind scrambles to process information unphantomable to mortal men.
With a twist of the hand, the spellcaster causes the bodies of their opponents to be consumed by coruscating blue flames.
With a twist of the hand, the spellcaster causes the bodies of their opponents to be consumed by coruscating blue flames.
The spellcaster whispers into the enemies' minds, subtly stoking the fires of healthy skepticism and individualism.
The spellcaster whispers into the enemies' minds, subtly stoking the fires of healthy skepticism and individualism.
Blistering balls of scarlet flame emanate from the spellcaster to engulf the foe in deadly balefire.
Blistering balls of scarlet flame emanate from the spellcaster to engulf the foe in deadly balefire.
Light, swift and deadly - the Katana is a powerful weapon if wielded by those who understand the art of Nipponese swordplay.
The Defenders of the Capital stand between their patron God and the profit he seeks to make. To face them is as if trying to steal from a diety.
All Dwarves in Marienburg are protected by Clan Fooger, a rich and powerful Clan who has settled the Wasteland centuries ago.
Den Euwe's are famed alchemists, brewing diverse potions with all sorts of effects. Faith will have it this particular batch will change you forever.
Those with the noble blood of Nipponese aristocrats running through their veins are blessed by the mythical god Orange Simca.
Famous and revered, the rice bowls from Nipponese come in endless of variaties. Each recipe uniquely tailored with it's own ingredients and coherent enhancing effects.
The Sword of W'soran captures the very essence of that which it slains, storing the souls of the unfortunate to be summoned to do it's wielder's bidding.
The Artifact traps the souls of those it comes in contact with, binding them to it's wielder for eternity, unleashing their essence releases powerful magic.
Mundvard has been controlling the city's underworld for years, known only as the 'Master of Shadows', his cape, masked in darkness, helped him achieve such as result.
The unliving are immune to the poisonous anther dust that smothers around the monkshood flowers, for the living it has desatrous effects however.
The Von Unterwald's, once a proud Westerlandic family, long extinct - yet their heirloom lives on situated on the dead ringfinger of Alicia.
Those who are offered the Ashen Rose can't refuse, those who accept it quickly suffocate as the rose withers in to dark magical aura.
It is not often one sees the banner of old Westerlandic Noblity, it reminisces of glorious times gone by and invigorates friendly troops.
Only the hardest, most steadfast raiders may call themselves amongst Kjotve's personal raiding crew. All that awaits them is either death or riches. Be it man or beast.
Forged in Beichai, these masks ooze odd magic and influence both their wearer as those who opposes them. A mere gaze from these strange eyes will frighten any foe.

The relationship between House Van den Nijmenk and the Kislevite culture is undisputable. There is a fiercy loyalty among Kislevites who sail under Sasha's flag, eager to repay his loyalty with blood.
Fed with orders that show incredible tactical brilliance, these Bretonnians are always one step ahead of their enemies.
''No, no no.. This is all wrong. If we do some sawing here, some hammering there and maybe finally we add some of this.. Yes - now the Ship will be much more stable and effective. I hope.''
Bone shattering schreeches echo around Aesllanan, afflicting those nearby. A melancholical piece, played terribly out of tune would distress even the foulest of abominations.
Armed with the finest bows, the Ghost-Strider regiments from Laurelorn are disputeably one of the deadliest archers in the Old World. Their teachings priceless.
High and mighty are the Asur that they view their foe as nothing but the insects they brush off their uncanningly shining army. Their arrogance grows with each landing blow.
Forged with ancient evil magic the Aegis of Stone makes it's wielder impetious to blows and strikes, all be it for a short period of time.
The Suzerain of the Seas was one of Marienburg's Wolfship flagships untill it was deemed lost over a century ago. This ship-in-a-bottle bears an awfull resemblance and appears to be.. moving.
Minor Saint of Manann, yet worshipped devotely in Suiddock. Olovald was a mighty seafarer with immense skill, his trident should only be wielded by those who call the Seas their home.
To the Order of the Albatross their symbol is more than a lucky charm, it acts as a sigil of protection. A bulwark to weather any storm.
Once wielded by the famed Count of Westerland, this fine Rapier is as graceful as it is deadly.
Although they would much rather avoid it, the Van de Kuypers do sanction paymasters to reward extra gold if they think it would serve their cause.
In the eyes of men Van de Kuyper's treasurers represent one thing: Immeasurable wealth. Surely that pie is big enough to feed us all, right? Right?
''Be purged all abominations and tread with fear, as the Knights of the Cleansing Flame come charging in!''
Helmet worn by the mythical Lorenzo Lupo - durable and magnificent, capable of warding off both arrow and blow.
Like flies flocking around a dead corpse, the Golden Pinions flock around the slain - relishing at the thought of relieving them from coin purses and other belongings.
Say it again! Who's a man among men? And then say it once more/ Who's the hero next door? Who's that man of success? Don't you know? Can't you guess?
Nothing rouses the common soldier like the words from a demagogue orator, brought forth with a fiery passion.
One finds the task of escaping the Watch easy when concealed in a mist of smoke.
There is only one universal language, spoken in the Old and New World. The language of money.
Finding the weakspots of equipment is just like cracking a safe.
Hidden in her left boot's heel, a veil she brought from her front working as a shopkeeper in Potion's Square.
A board the Black Dove Captain Maefcross would often tighten the knots himself, trusting his abilities to shore up even a crashed Landship with a few simple knots.
None has the verbal and rhetorical skill to tell the story of the Savonarola as Maefcross, a story of riches lost on a unfindable island, yet ripe for the taking for those who know where to look.
The Red Talons often serve as a firing line for executions, often resorting to chaining the prisoners frantically escaping their final destiny.
This Merchant Lord wears the Sigil of the Van de Kuypers, availing oneself of Jaan's personal protection.
Sometimes, even the flood can be used as a weapon just by breaching a few dams.
The Lords of the Directorate know there's only one thing that truly moves men. Not fear, not hope, not loyalty not cause. It is greed.
The Lords of the Directorate know there's only one thing that truly moves men. Not fear, not hope, not loyalty not cause. It is greed.
The ceremonial mace of Haeyndrik is imbued with magical luck, and is only to be wielded by the Arch-Priest himself.
The Lord Harbourmaster is skilled at calculating exact distances, a trait proven useful not only at sea - but at scoping foes all the same.
With anchors firmly hooked in to solid ground even the lightest of infantry holds the line like immovable statues.
The Lord Harbourmaster's office recieves any letters for incoming ships in advance, one can only imagine what morale boosts these messages from home give.
A deadly mixture of dwarfish and empiric powder, the explosiveness of the powder stored at Strompoort is as diverse as the city-state itself.
A roe with magical tendencies, channeling the names of legendary sailors, seamen and harbourmasters. It splites open ranks like ships on spikey rocks.
The Wave Lord has Manann's outmost blessing, bestowing upon him the very essence of the sea.
The might of the seven seas withstand the essence of time itself, Manann blesses men with a fraction of his might to withstand their share.
Manann's blessing lingers as soft drops of water around those he deems worthy.
The Wave Lord implores Manann to imbue him with a modicum of divine strength, and now his trident glows bright with power!
A battle prayer that bathes the Wave Lord in sea water, soaking Manann’s foes but leaving the supplicant unharmed.
The Slavemaster flexes his whip, instilling fear in those who have tasted it's fury.
A fabled story among Marienburgers is that of Captain Erkart Dubnitz wrestling a beluga whale, who he not only bested but befriended. It is said Erkart was blessed ever since.
It is said that anchors blessed by Manann at the High Temple have the power to dock ships even in the most hazardous of storms.
The Legend of Mannslieb tells that Manann fell in love with a woman, Lileath. It is her that watches over the creatures of her Sea, sending them only to aid those in Manann's absolute favour.
The caster unleashes a powerful torrent of seawater from their outstretched hand.
The caster curses the enemy to feel as if they are standing upon the deck of a storm-tossed ship.
The caster is filled with an uncanny sense of where they might find a desired creature in the sea, and by concentrating they can summon the creature to them.
The enemy's lungs immediately fill with salt water, making it impossible for them to speak, and other actions far more difficult.
The enemy's lungs immediately fill with salt water, making it impossible for them to speak, and other actions far more difficult.
Water is summoned by the caster and draws itself up to form a huge, churning wave, which then crashes down on the enemy.
Water is summoned by the caster and draws itself up to form a huge, churning wave, which then crashes down on the enemy.
The caster summons and animates a large amount of sea water, than batters the enemy into submission.
The caster summons and animates a large amount of sea water, than batters the enemy into submission.
Anyone tasting the water feels immediately invigorated and refreshed.
Anyone tasting the water feels immediately invigorated and refreshed.
The caster unleashes a powerful torrent of seawater from their outstretched hand.
The caster unleashes a powerful torrent of seawater from their outstretched hand.
A graduate of Baron Henryk's College and an expert at Sea Magicks.
Odrall the Devout was renowned for his piety and a holy obsession with exploration. As High Priest of Manann he discovered large parts of the new world. His teachings still linger today.
Probably not best suited for actual fishing, yet these hooks still retain a impressive grip.
Infused by Manann's sheer magical will, the Ancient Augus is frightening on land, yet even more so in it's natural habitat.
The Angus swarm fights most effectively in the cold depths near the ocean floor.
The very essence of the sea channels through Manann's five-tined crown and radiates among those in it's surroundings.
The sea creatures carrying Manann's blessing traverse the seabed unscathed.
The magical infused trident that was swallowed over nine years ago by the Red Chaos Whale now radiates sinister magic.
Fooger started a young blacksmith, with the ability to forge or melt even the finest of armour.
Infused with Dwarven runic powers the Key to House Fooger unlocks a door clearly imported from the deep mines of Dwarven holds of old. It's power unleashes a mighty smite.
Trained by Jubal Falk, Ogg learned the fine art of a steady aim.
Serving as prime executioner among Bretonnian Nobility many throughout the stretched fields have come to fear Palldee's Hammer.
It is unsure how long Rashasawa spent on the mysterious Isle of Nippon, fact is he learned much about the art of swordplay there.

Ostlander pork belly is not only Jaan's favorite, it's also distinguishly exported by Osterlander Elector Count Von Raukov. Not just a valuable trade opportunity, Osterland would also account for a powerful military ally in Marienburg's expansionistic views.

Baron Henryk's College of Navigation and Sea Magicks is one of the Old World's premier centres of learning the crafts of seamanship. Pieter learned however, a hook has more functionalities than learned at Baron Henryk's.
A gift from a Wastelander is never rejected, just don't unwrap it close to it's giver..

Big Piet is the man who upheld the honour of the guild (and the whole Suiddock) in a trial-by-combat against the champion of a Tilean merchant house, as he has bested many champions in these trials before.
Creates an illusion of the Sword of Solkan
